channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: TLP: A Deep Learning-based Cost Model for Tensor Program Tuning
item.description: Instead of extracting features from the tensor program itself, TLP extracts features from the schedule primitives.

item.title: Using Set Covering to Generate Databases for Holistic Steganalysis
item.description: Within an operational framework, covers used by a steganographer are likely to come from different sensors and different processing pipelines than the ones used by researchers for training their steganalysis models.

item.title: Moving Frame Net: SE(3)-Equivariant Network for Volumes
item.description: Equivariance of neural networks to transformations helps to improve their performance and reduce generalization error in computer vision tasks, as they apply to datasets presenting symmetries (e. g. scalings, rotations, translations).

item.title: Fixing Model Bugs with Natural Language Patches
item.description: Current approaches for fixing systematic problems in NLP models (e. g. regex patches, finetuning on more data) are either brittle, or labor-intensive and liable to shortcuts.

item.title: Complex Hyperbolic Knowledge Graph Embeddings with Fast Fourier Transform
item.description: However, the performance of the hyperbolic KG embedding models for non-transitive relations is still unpromising, while the complex hyperbolic embeddings do not deal with multi-relations.

item.title: Debiasing Graph Transfer Learning via Item Semantic Clustering for Cross-Domain Recommendations
item.description: To address this data sparsity problem, cross-domain recommender systems (CDRSs) exploit the data from an auxiliary source domain to facilitate the recommendation on the sparse target domain.

item.title: Technical Report on Web-based Visual Corpus Construction for Visual Document Understanding
item.description: We present a dataset generator engine named Web-based Visual Corpus Builder (Webvicob).

item.title: AfroLM: A Self-Active Learning-based Multilingual Pretrained Language Model for 23 African Languages
item.description: In this paper, we present AfroLM, a multilingual language model pretrained from scratch on 23 African languages (the largest effort to date) using our novel self-active learning framework.

item.title: Black-Box Attack against GAN-Generated Image Detector with Contrastive Perturbation
item.description: It is significant to assess the vulnerability of such forensic detectors against adversarial attacks.

item.title: Spatiotemporal forecasting of track geometry irregularities with exogenous factors
item.description: In this study, we propose a method to forecast one type of track geometry irregularity, vertical alignment, by incorporating spatial and exogenous factor calculations.

item.title: ERNIE-SAT: Speech and Text Joint Pretraining for Cross-Lingual Multi-Speaker Text-to-Speech
item.description: In this paper, we extend the pretraining method for cross-lingual multi-speaker speech synthesis tasks, including cross-lingual multi-speaker voice cloning and cross-lingual multi-speaker speech editing.

item.title: Accented Text-to-Speech Synthesis with a Conditional Variational Autoencoder
item.description: Accent plays a significant role in speech communication, influencing understanding capabilities and also conveying a person's identity.

item.title: Max-Min Off-Policy Actor-Critic Method Focusing on Worst-Case Robustness to Model Misspecification
item.description: In this study, we focus on scenarios involving a simulation environment with uncertainty parameters and the set of their possible values, called the uncertainty parameter set.

item.title: Image Completion with Heterogeneously Filtered Spectral Hints
item.description: We also prove the effectiveness of our design via ablation studies, from which one may notice that the aforementioned challenges, i. e. pattern unawareness, blurry textures, and structure distortion, can be noticeably resolved.

item.title: Zero-Shot Classification by Logical Reasoning on Natural Language Explanations
item.description: Humans can classify an unseen category by reasoning on its language explanations.

item.title: CRIPP-VQA: Counterfactual Reasoning about Implicit Physical Properties via Video Question Answering
item.description: Videos often capture objects, their visible properties, their motion, and the interactions between different objects.

item.title: SLOPT: Bandit Optimization Framework for Mutation-Based Fuzzing
item.description: Fuzzing can be optimized when targeting specific programs, and given that, some studies have employed online optimization methods to do it automatically, i. e., tuning fuzzers for any given program in a program-agnostic manner.

item.title: No Word Embedding Model Is Perfect: Evaluating the Representation Accuracy for Social Bias in the Media
item.description: To cover the whole spectrum of political bias in the US, we collect 500k articles and review psychology literature with respect to expected social bias.

item.title: Curriculum-based Asymmetric Multi-task Reinforcement Learning
item.description: To mitigate the negative influence of customizing the one-off training order in curriculum-based AMTL, CAMRL switches its training mode between parallel single-task RL and asymmetric multi-task RL (MTRL), according to an indicator regarding the training time, the overall performance, and the performance gap among tasks.

item.title: Sparse Horseshoe Estimation via Expectation-Maximisation
item.description: A particular strength of our approach is that the M-step depends only on the form of the prior and it is independent of the form of the likelihood.

item.title: pyGSL: A Graph Structure Learning Toolkit
item.description: Implementations of differentiable graph structure learning models are written in PyTorch, allowing us to leverage the rich software ecosystem that exists e. g., around logging, hyperparameter search, and GPU-communication.

item.title: DPCSpell: A Transformer-based Detector-Purificator-Corrector Framework for Spelling Error Correction of Bangla and Resource Scarce Indic Languages
item.description: Earlier efforts on spelling error correction in Bangla and resource-scarce Indic languages focused on rule-based, statistical, and machine learning-based methods which we found rather inefficient.

item.title: Learning Semantic Textual Similarity via Topic-informed Discrete Latent Variables
item.description: Recently, discrete latent variable models have received a surge of interest in both Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Computer Vision (CV), attributed to their comparable performance to the continuous counterparts in representation learning, while being more interpretable in their predictions.

item.title: From Denoising Diffusions to Denoising Markov Models
item.description: Denoising diffusions are state-of-the-art generative models which exhibit remarkable empirical performance and come with theoretical guarantees.

item.title: AlphaPose: Whole-Body Regional Multi-Person Pose Estimation and Tracking in Real-Time
item.description: Accurate whole-body multi-person pose estimation and tracking is an important yet challenging topic in computer vision.

item.title: SC-DepthV3: Robust Self-supervised Monocular Depth Estimation for Dynamic Scenes
item.description: Self-supervised monocular depth estimation has shown impressive results in static scenes.

item.title: Efficient Multi-order Gated Aggregation Network
item.description: Since the recent success of Vision Transformers (ViTs), explorations toward transformer-style architectures have triggered the resurgence of modern ConvNets.

item.title: 3D Harmonic Loss: Towards Task-consistent and Time-friendly 3D Object Detection on Edge for Intelligent Transportation System
item.description: Edge computing-based 3D perception has received attention in intelligent transportation systems (ITS) because real-time monitoring of traffic candidates potentially strengthens Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X) orchestration.

item.title: Contrastive Learning enhanced Author-Style Headline Generation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel Seq2Seq model called CLH3G (Contrastive Learning enhanced Historical Headlines based Headline Generation) which can use the historical headlines of the articles that the author wrote in the past to improve the headline generation of current articles.

item.title: PeSOTIF: a Challenging Visual Dataset for Perception SOTIF Problems in Long-tail Traffic Scenarios
item.description: Perception algorithms in autonomous driving systems confront great challenges in long-tail traffic scenarios, where the problems of Safety of the Intended Functionality (SOTIF) could be triggered by the algorithm performance insufficiencies and dynamic operational environment.

item.title: Suffix Retrieval-Augmented Language Modeling
item.description: SUREALM employs an embedding retriever to search for training sentences in a data store that share similar word history during sequence generation.

item.title: Robust Lottery Tickets for Pre-trained Language Models
item.description: Recent works on Lottery Ticket Hypothesis have shown that pre-trained language models (PLMs) contain smaller matching subnetworks(winning tickets) which are capable of reaching accuracy comparable to the original models.

item.title: WeakIdent: Weak formulation for Identifying Differential Equations using Narrow-fit and Trimming
item.description: We propose a general and robust framework to recover differential equations using a weak formulation, for both ordinary and partial differential equations (ODEs and PDEs).

item.title: UATTA-ENS: Uncertainty Aware Test Time Augmented Ensemble for PIRC Diabetic Retinopathy Detection
item.description: Deep Ensemble Convolutional Neural Networks has become a methodology of choice for analyzing medical images with a diagnostic performance comparable to a physician, including the diagnosis of Diabetic Retinopathy.

item.title: Tuning Language Models as Training Data Generators for Augmentation-Enhanced Few-Shot Learning
item.description: In this work, we study few-shot learning with PLMs from a different perspective: We first tune an autoregressive PLM on the few-shot samples and then use it as a generator to synthesize a large amount of novel training samples which augment the original training set.

item.title: Calibration Meets Explanation: A Simple and Effective Approach for Model Confidence Estimates
item.description: We conduct extensive experiments on six datasets with two popular pre-trained language models in the in-domain and out-of-domain settings.

item.title: Motion Style Transfer: Modular Low-Rank Adaptation for Deep Motion Forecasting
item.description: To this end, we introduce two components that exploit our prior knowledge of motion style shifts: (i) a low-rank motion style adapter that projects and adjusts the style features at a low-dimensional bottleneck; and (ii) a modular adapter strategy that disentangles the features of scene context and motion history to facilitate a fine-grained choice of adaptation layers.

item.title: Graph Neural Networks for Community Detection on Sparse Graphs
item.description: Spectral methods provide consistent estimators for community detection in dense graphs.

item.title: Hear The Flow: Optical Flow-Based Self-Supervised Visual Sound Source Localization
item.description: Existing work in this area focuses on creating attention maps to capture the correlation between the two modalities to localize the source of the sound.

item.title: Learning Dual-Fused Modality-Aware Representations for RGBD Tracking
item.description: The second aims at integrating the RGB-specific and depth-specific information to enhance the fused features.

item.title: Synthetic Data for Feature Selection
item.description: Feature selection is an important and active field of research in machine learning and data science.

item.title: Characterizing the Efficiency of Graph Neural Network Frameworks with a Magnifying Glass
item.description: In particular, unlike the traditional GNNs that are trained based on the entire graph in a full-batch manner, recent GNNs have been developed with different graph sampling techniques for mini-batch training of GNNs on large graphs.

item.title: Learning to Annotate Part Segmentation with Gradient Matching
item.description: The success of state-of-the-art deep neural networks heavily relies on the presence of large-scale labelled datasets, which are extremely expensive and time-consuming to annotate.

item.title: A Survey of Deep Face Restoration: Denoise, Super-Resolution, Deblur, Artifact Removal
item.description: Second, we discuss the challenges of face restoration.

item.title: Textual Manifold-based Defense Against Natural Language Adversarial Examples
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first NLP defense that leverages the manifold structure against adversarial attacks.

item.title: Learning to Infer from Unlabeled Data: A Semi-supervised Learning Approach for Robust Natural Language Inference
item.description: However, despite its substantial success on single sentence classification tasks where the challenge in making use of unlabeled data is to assign "good enough" pseudo-labels, for NLI tasks, the nature of unlabeled data is more complex: one of the sentences in the pair (usually the hypothesis) along with the class label are missing from the data and require human annotations, which makes SSL for NLI more challenging.

item.title: One Person, One Model--Learning Compound Router for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: The core idea of CANet is to route the input user behaviors with a light-weighted router module.

item.title: New Definitions and Evaluations for Saliency Methods: Staying Intrinsic, Complete and Sound
item.description: Saliency methods compute heat maps that highlight portions of an input that were most {\em important} for the label assigned to it by a deep net.

item.title: BEKG: A Built Environment Knowledge Graph
item.description: In this paper, more than 80, 000 paper abstracts in the built environment field were obtained to build a knowledge graph, a knowledge base storing entities and their connective relations in a graph-structured data model.

item.title: Differentiable Neural Computers with Memory Demon
item.description: A Differentiable Neural Computer (DNC) is a neural network with an external memory which allows for iterative content modification via read, write and delete operations.
